Package graph

Class Box

java.lang.Object
graph.Box
All Implemented Interfaces:
IOInterface, Vertex
Direct Known Subclasses:
BridgeBox, DummyBox, EmptyBox, StairsBox, WallBox, WaterBox
public abstract class Box
extends java.lang.Object
implements Vertex, IOInterface
This abstract class implements a graph's vertex. It provides general features such as coordinates or flags.

  • Constructor Details

    • Box

      public Box()
      Constructs a Box with coordinates (0, 0, 0) and no flag. This box however should not be used unless a call to IO method read has been processed successfully.

    • Box

      public Box​(int x, int y, int z)
      Constructs a Box with given coordinates and no flag.
      Parameters:
      x - , y, z are the coordinates of the Box.

  • Method Details

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Returns the ID of the box.
      Specified by:
      getID in interface Vertex
      Returns:
      the ID of the box.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns the X coordinate.
      Returns:
      the X coordinate.

    • setX

      protected boolean setX​(int x)
      Sets the X coordinate to a given value. If the value is incorrect (i.e. negative), the coordinate is not changed.
      Parameters:
      x - is the coordinate to be set.
      Returns:
      true if x was a correct value, false otherwise.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns the Y coordinate.
      Returns:
      the Y coordinate.

    • setY

      protected boolean setY​(int y)
      Sets the Y coordinate to a given value. If the value is incorrect (i.e. negative), the coordinate is not changed.
      Parameters:
      y - is the coordinate to be set.
      Returns:
      true if y was a correct value, false otherwise.

    • getZ

      public int getZ()
      Returns the Z coordinate.
      Returns:
      the Z coordinate.

    • setZ

      protected boolean setZ​(int z)
      Sets the Z coordinate to a given value. If the value is incorrect (i.e. negative), the coordinate is not changed.
      Parameters:
      z - is the coordinate to be set.
      Returns:
      true if z was a correct value, false otherwise.

    • getPracticability

      public abstract int getPracticability()
      Returns the practicability of the box, i.e. the weight to be applied in the graph.
      Returns:
      the practicability of the box.

    • getFlags

      public int getFlags()
      Returns the flags as an integer.
      Returns:
      the flags of the box.

    • hasFlag

      public boolean hasFlag​(int flag)
      Indicates whether the box carries a given flag.
      Parameters:
      flag - is the flag to be looked for.
      Returns:
      true if the box carries the flag, false otherwise. If the flag is invalid, returns false.

    • setFlags

      public void setFlags​(int flags)
      Sets the flags to a given value. There is no guarantee for the value of flags to be under MAX_FLAG.
      Parameters:
      flags - is the new value.

    • addFlag

      public void addFlag​(int flag)
      Adds a flag to the box. The method does not guarantee the new value of flags is under MAX_FLAG.
      Parameters:
      flag - is the flag to be added. It should contain only one 1 in its binary form.

    • remFlag

      public void remFlag​(int flag)
      Removes a flag to the box if it is carried.
      Parameters:
      flag - is the flag to be removed.

    • clearFlags

      public void clearFlags()
      Clears all flags.

    • writeGeneralData

      protected void writeGeneralData​(java.io.OutputStream out) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the coordinates and the flags of the box in an output stream.
      Parameters:
      out - is the output stream in which the values are written.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • readRawData

      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> readRawData​(java.io.InputStream in) throws java.io.IOException
      Reads the parameters of a box from an input stream, stops when the value 255 or -1 is read.
      Parameters:
      in - is the input stream containing the parameters of the box.
      Returns:
      a list of parameters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • write

      public abstract void write​(java.io.OutputStream out) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes all the parameters of the box in an output stream.
      Specified by:
      write in interface IOInterface
      Parameters:
      out - is the output stream to be written.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • read

      public abstract void read​(java.io.InputStream in) throws java.io.IOException, BadFormatException, ReadingException
      Reads the box from an input stream.
      Specified by:
      read in interface IOInterface
      Parameters:
      in - is the input stream to be read.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - is an I/O error occurs.
      BadFormatException - if the number of parameters given is incorrect.
      ReadingException - if a parameter has an incorrect value.

      public abstract void display()
